name: Software Functional Testing Trainee
description:
EPAM Campus offers a free Software Functional Testing training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will explore various testing types, methods and approaches, master test planning, requirements analysis and creating effective checklists, as well as learn how to report test results.

You can progress through this self-paced program at your convenience, as all learning materials will be accessible anytime. On average, you will need ~ 10 weeks and ~ 20 hours of weekly engagement.

Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with software development & testing life cycles and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing basics (Test Artifacts, Test Methods, Types and Levels, Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Strong communication skills

Nice to have:

  • Understanding of programming basics, networks, API and databases

We offer

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Automated Testing in .NET Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in .NET training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in –°# and the .NET platform, as well as master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~ 2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of C# programming (Integers, Static Methods, Boolean and Logical Operators, Conditional Statements, Real Numbers, Exceptions, Iteration Statements)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan
  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: PHP Developer
description:
Andersen is hiring a PHP Developer for a Saudi Arabia holding company. The project focuses on verifying workers‚Äô qualifications to improve skill quality and productivity in the labor market.

The customer is a holding company in the labour market in Saudi Arabia, operating under the Ministry of Labor. It leads the socio-economic transformation for individuals, society, and the economy by creating unique solutions to fulfil everyone's needs.

This project aims to verify that professional workers possess the qualifications and skills required to perform their jobs in Saudi Arabia, which contributes to raising the quality of skill levels in the labor market and raising productivity.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing, maintaining, and enhancing web applications using PHP Symfony framework.
  • Writing clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
  • Collaborating with the team to understand project requirements and specifications.
  • Integrating third-party APIs and services.
  • Troubleshooting, debugging, and resolving technical issues.
  • Implementing security and data protection measures.
  • Optimizing application performance and scalability.
  • Conducting code reviews and providing constructive feedback to team members.
  • Ensuring code quality through different types of testing and continuous integration.

Must-haves:

  • Experience as a PHP Developer for 3+ years.
  • Experience working with Drupal or any other PHP-based CMS.
  • Ability to work in a DevOps mindset with following CI/CD principles.
  • Fluent knowledge of containers and orchestrators technologies specifically Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Ability to develop code in a SOA fashion.
  • Ability to design and implement relational and/or non-relational database structures.
  • Fluent with object-oriented programming and software design patterns.
  • Fluent with utilizing and developing web service APIs.
  • Strong understanding of software architecture techniques.
  • Ability to work as a member of an Agile development team.
  • Ability to lead in a team environment without direct authority.
  • Demonstrated and proved skills of working with integrating with payment gateways both synchronously and asynchronously.
  • Excellent problem-solving and organizational abilities with attention to detail.
  • Level of English ‚Äì from Intermediate+ and above.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Linux oriented person.
  • Ability to present to all levels of staff and leadership.

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you:

  • Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc..
  • The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain.
  • Job conditions ‚Äì you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant.
  • Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee.
  • The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 USD per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities.
  • Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated.
  • Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies).
  • Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc).
  • Referral program.
  • English courses.
  • Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities.

Your personal data is protected in accordance with GDPR regulations.

Join us!

name: SAP Developer (BTP/CAP)
description:
At LeverX, we have had the privilege of working on over 1500 SAP projects, including some with Fortune 500 companies. With 20+ years in the market, our team of 2,200 is strong, reliable, and always evolving: learning, growing, and striving for excellence.

We are looking for a SAP Developer to join us. Let‚Äôs see if we are a good fit for each other!

What we offer:

  • 89% of projects use the newest SAP technologies and frameworks.

  • Expert communities and internal courses.

  • Market-based compensation and regular performance reviews.

  • Valuable perks to support your growth and well-being.

Required skills:

  • Strong experience in SAP ecosystem and development.

  • In-depth knowledge of Cloud Foundry environment.

  • Experience with modern SAP technologies: CAP, CPI, Workflow.

  • At least an overview of ABAP Environment in BTP.

  • Ability to create design diagrams, estimate tasks, and conduct technical investigations.

  • English level B2+.

Note: Candidates with more experience are welcome. Minimum experience required: 1‚Äì3 years.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop SAP BTP projects, including integration with S/4HANA and other SAP systems.

  • Collaborate with Tech Leads / Architects to align solutions with project requirements.

  • Participate in presales activities: review requirements, prepare technical solutions and PoCs, support high-level project estimations.

  • Engage in full-cycle SAP development as a backend developer.

  • Work closely with clients to understand business needs and deliver tailored SAP solutions.

  • Stay up-to-date with latest SAP BTP features and participate in internal knowledge-sharing initiatives.

  • Write clear technical documentation and elaborations for development projects.
key_skills: SAP, BTP, CAP, Node.js, Cloud Foundry, CPI, Business English

name: Middle/Senior Backend Software Engineer (NestJS‚ÄØ/‚ÄØNode.js)
description:
Investbanq is an AI-powered wealth operating system for family offices, asset managers and banks. We are empowering traditional financial institutions to rapidly transform into AI-driven WealthTech players, enabling them to effectively capitalize on the growing wealth transfer to affluent millennials and other digital natives across emerging Asia and MENA. We are scaling quickly across Asia and MENA and are assembling a high‚Äëcalibre engineering team to power our next phase of growth.

Why this role matters

Our backend is the heart of the platform ‚Äì processing trades, crunching analytics, and securing sensitive data in real time. You‚Äôll own critical services built with NestJS and AWS serverless, shaping everything from data models to deployment pipelines. If you thrive on clean architecture, low‚Äëlatency code, and ‚Äúeverything‚Äëas‚Äëcode‚Äù DevOps, you‚Äôll feel right at home.

Tech stack

  • Backend ‚Äì NestJS‚ÄØ/‚ÄØNode‚ÄØ20, TypeScript
  • APIs ‚Äì REST, GraphQL
  • Data ‚Äì PostgreSQL‚ÄØ(TimescaleDB), Redis Cluster, S3
  • Messaging ‚Äì AWS SQS (DLQ), Redis pub/sub
  • Compute ‚Äì AWS ECS‚ÄØ(Fargate), AWS Lambda
  • Edge & Auth ‚Äì AWS API Gateway, Cognito (OIDC)
  • IaC & CI/CD ‚Äì Terraform, GitLab CI, Docker
  • Security ‚Äì AWS KMS, envelope encryption, least‚Äëprivilege IAM

Responsibilities

Design & build core services

  • develop REST and GraphQL APIs in NestJS (Node‚ÄØ20 + TypeScript)
  • model transactional and market‚Äëdata workflows in PostgreSQL‚ÄØ/‚ÄØTimescaleDB

Scale & harden the platform

  • implement event‚Äëdriven patterns with SQS (DLQs) and Redis pub/sub
  • optimise hot paths for sub‚Äë100‚ÄØms latency; profile and eliminate bottlenecks

Ship with confidence

  • write unit, integration, and load tests; enforce coverage thresholds
  • automate everything with GitLab CI/CD, Terraform, and Docker ‚Üí ECS

Collaborate & mentor

  • work closely with product, QA, and front‚Äëend team (React‚ÄØ+‚ÄØNext.js)
  • review code, share knowledge, and raise the engineering bar for everyone

Requirements

Must-have

  • 3‚ÄØ+‚ÄØyears building production back‚Äëends in Node.js‚ÄØ/‚ÄØTypeScript (preferably NestJS)
  • deep SQL skills with PostgreSQL; you know when to reach for indexes, CTEs, and partitioning
  • hands‚Äëon AWS: API Gateway, Lambda, ECS, S3, SQS, KMS
  • comfortable with Docker

Nice-to-have

  • experience in fintech, trading, or high‚Äëcompliance domains
  • familiarity with TimescaleDB or other time‚Äëseries DBs
  • graphQL subscriptions, Apollo Federation, or event sourcing
  • observability stacks (OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana)
  • knowledge of SOC‚ÄØ2, ISO‚ÄØ27001, or similar frameworks
  • contributions to OSS, tech blogs, or conference talks

Working conditions

  • hybrid work environment: 3 days in the office, 2 days remote

  • modern office location in Almaty

  • official employment in compliance with AIFC Employment Regulations

  • opportunities for professional growth and career progression

  • multilingual working environment

  • exposure to cutting-edge AI-driven WealthTech solutions

  • a collaborative and inclusive corporate culture that values innovation and initiative

  • periodic remote (e.g., during winter) from year 2

  • ESOP participation from year 2

name: Software Functional Testing Intern
description:
EPAM Campus offers an intensive Software Functional Testing internship program that will equip you with the deep knowledge and hands-on experience needed to kickstart your career in tech. EPAM professionals will help you learn to conduct requirements analysis for real use cases, develop your skills in creating test artifacts for a specific project, as well as explore the basics of prompt engineering and AI tools for QA specialists.

This program will last ~2-4 months and require ~20-40 hours of weekly engagement. The more time you devote to learning, the faster you will complete it.

Upon its successful completion, we will consider you for open positions based on your demonstrated skills and available opportunities at EPAM.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with the software development & testing life cycle and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing theory‚ÄØ(Test Artifacts; Test Methods, Types and Levels; Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Experience with requirement analysis, test design and defect reporting
  • Excellent communication skills

Nice to have:

Familiarity with API testing and SQL queries

We offer

  • Market-oriented content tested in hundreds of runs
  • Deep dive into your specialization and related emerging technologies
  • Hands-on learning through practical tasks and real project simulations
  • Regular guidance from technology mentors and your Resource Manager
  • AI tools to deliver a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Access to EPAM internal education resources for professional growth
  • Chance to join our team upon successful graduation

name: Software Functional Testing Trainee
description:
EPAM Campus offers a free Software Functional Testing training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will explore various testing types, methods and approaches, master test planning, requirements analysis and creating effective checklists, as well as learn how to report test results.

You can progress through this self-paced program at your convenience, as all learning materials will be accessible anytime. On average, you will need ~ 10 weeks and ~ 20 hours of weekly engagement.

Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with software development & testing life cycles and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing basics (Test Artifacts, Test Methods, Types and Levels, Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Strong communication skills

Nice to have:

  • Understanding of programming basics, networks, API and databases

We offer

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Atlassian Engineer
description:
Softgile Company - Atlassian Platinum Solution Partner is a provider of different business solutions on Atlassian products for IT and business.
Due to the dynamic development of projects, we are looking for Atlassian Engineer to join one of our department in Kazakhstan.

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Realization of projects on Atlassian products;
‚Ä¢ Set up and configuration of Atlassian products (Jira Core, Software, Service Desk, Portfolio, Confluence, BitBucket);
‚Ä¢ Set up and configuration Insight, Tempo, BigPicture plugins;
‚Ä¢ Automation of ScriptRunner, Insight, Jira Workflow Toolbox, nFeed processes;
‚Ä¢ Developing of scripts on groovy (script console, intellij idea, bitbucket).

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, etc.);
‚Ä¢ Experience configuring workflows, custom fields, and permissions;
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in scripting (e.g., Groovy, ScriptRunner) and Jira Automation;
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with REST APIs for system integrations;
‚Ä¢ Managing tool performance, updates, and troubleshooting;
‚Ä¢ Expertise in migrations, upgrades, and integrations with external systems;
‚Ä¢ Fluent Kazakh is the must, English B2, knowledge of Ukrainian or Russian language will be plus.

We offer:
‚Ä¢ Remote work format or hybrid model in our office in Almaty;
‚Ä¢ Official employment with paid vacation, sick leaves, Public Holidays according Kazakhstan labor code;‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã
‚Ä¢ Corporate psychologist;
‚Ä¢ All necessary equipment for a comfortable and productive work setup;
‚Ä¢ Coverage of coworking expenses to support flexible and remote work;
‚Ä¢ Access to training programs and professional courses to grow your expertise;
‚Ä¢ Exciting opportunities for professional development in a high-tech environment;
‚Ä¢ Career growth and internal mobility within a fast-growing multinational company;
‚Ä¢ Dynamic and supportive team culture focused on collaboration and innovation.

Interview steps: 1. HR intro call. 2. Technical Interview. 3. Offer.

name: Automated Testing in Java Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in Java training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in Java and master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of Java programming (Data Types, Conditions and Loops, Arrays, Classes)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials

  • Technology mentors from around the globe

  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs

  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience

  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Full Stack Developer (Python+React)
description:
Andersen is hiring a Full Stack Developer (Python+React) to build an AI-powered document ingestion and content-extraction solution that automates large-scale document processing and improves efficiency across the organization.

The customer is a global energy technology company with a large international footprint, delivering solutions for power generation, transmission, and industrial electrification. Known for its focus on sustainability and innovation, the organization invests heavily in research and development to support decarbonization efforts, enhance energy reliability, and advance modern renewable and digital energy technologies.

The project is focused on building an AI-powered document ingestion and content-extraction solution as part of a broader digital transformation initiative. It aims to automate how large volumes of documents are processed, using modern AI technologies to improve efficiency, accuracy, and decision-making across the organization.

Stack: Python, React, FastAPI, Flask, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, Redis, OpenSearch, MongoDB, Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock, LangChain, LangGraph, AWS, GitLab CI/CD, OAuth2/OIDC (Entra ID), RBAC.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable asynchronous APIs using Python frameworks such as FastAPI and Flask.
  • Working hands-on with SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL, and in-memory stores like Redis to support diverse application needs.
  • Integrating and optimizing vector databases (e.g., OpenSearch, MongoDB) for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) use cases.
  • Implementing and fine-tuning solutions leveraging Azure OpenAI and Amazon Bedrock.
  • Utilizing frameworks such as LangChain and LangGraph to orchestrate advanced language model workflows.
  • Deploying and managing applications on AWS services, ensuring scalability, security, and cost efficiency.
  • Building and maintaining automated pipelines with GitLab CI/CD for continuous integration and delivery.

Must-haves:

  • Hands-on Python development experience, with a strong focus on building robust, scalable systems for 5+ years.
  • Experience with Python and frameworks such as FastAPI and Flask to build scalable, async APIs, with testing, logging, and performance tuning.
  • Required experience in React to build accessible, reliable UIs with real-time streaming and robust state management.
  • Hands-on with SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL, in-memory stores (Redis), and preferably vector databases for RAG (OpenSearch, MongoDB).
  • Familiar with AWS services and automated pipelines using GitLab CI/CD.
  • Strong understanding of OAuth2/OIDC (Entra ID), RBAC, SOLID principles, clean architecture, and maintainable code practices.
  • Experience working with machine learning concepts, model integration, and applying ML techniques within production systems.
  • Level of English ‚Äì from Upper-Intermediate and above.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Strong familiarity with LLM/RAG workflows using Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock, and frameworks like LangChain and LangGraph.

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you:

  • Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc..
  • The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain.
  • Job conditions ‚Äì you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant.
  • Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee.
  • The opportunity to earn additional up to 1,000 EUR per month by participating in the company's activities.
  • Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated.
  • Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies).
  • Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc).
  • Referral program.
  • English courses.
  • Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities.

Join us!

name: Lead Engineer: Static
description:
Tasks/Activities/Responsibilities:

Below listed are the major responsibilities of Lead Engineer: Static during the contract tenure:

Control and ensuring that all required standards and specifications are developed and applied

Overview and preparation of recommendations of local and international standards applicable to the Project

Review of design concepts and, if necessary, presenting its comments to the design concept, timely submission of comments in case of any deviations from the requirements

Monitoring and ensuring that design solutions meet the requirements for safety, operability, maintenance, accessibility and constructability

Control and ensuring the preparation of appropriate volume of main documents of detailed design stage

Review and verify of key engineering documents, such as a plot plan, piping and instrumentation diagrams, cause-effect matrixes, electrical single- line diagrams, control panel drawings, building layout drawings, specifications and requirements for equipment.

Control and ensure that manuals and operating instructions, mechanical dossiers are suitable for subsequent start-up, operation and maintenance of units

Participating on behalf of the Company in P&ID, HAZOP, SIL, Plot Plan review sessions, quantitative risk assessment and 3D model review meetings, maintainability and operability reviews organized by the EPC Contractor, and ensuring that these technical results will be prepared in accordance with the Project requirements and good engineering practices

Review engineering deliverables and initiate appropriate corrective action.

Review of Equipment engineering drawings.

Review of Material changer proposals from EPC Contractor and vendors;

Review of Heat calculations for heat exchangers

Develops project objectives by reviewing project proposals and plans and conferring with management.

Responsible for all aspects of static/package equipment selection, design, procurement, installation, commissioning, and start-up planning. Provide overall static and package equipment technical leadership and expertise.

Ensures the Project's requirements, as detailed in the Technical Specifications, for all Static/package equipment are met. Coordinate with other disciplines of PMT for progressing the design, procurement, manufacture, erection, commissioning and start-up of static and package equipment activities to adhere to project schedule.

Review Piping and Instrumentation Drawings (P&IDs) for safe and operable static equipment features. Review, comment and approve work performed by FEED/EPC Contractor and vendors to ensure the work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, company standards, and regulatory requirements. Includes review of thermal, mechanical design drawings, calculations, documents, and specifications.

Identify deviations if any and manage them as per project procedures with appropriate approval.

Directs and oversees the activities of inspection, monitoring and certifying the quality of all static and package equipment and project installations.

Reviews inspection programs (if required by the project), inspections, Non-Destructive Tests (NDT) and general surveys on systems such as pressurized vessels, columns, reactors, fired heaters, vendor packages and structures to ensure adherence to project specifications, manufacturing tolerance and code compliance.

Assist Engineering Manager in stewarding FEED/EPC Contractor's activities with respect to static and package equipment engineering execution.

Ensure that the contractor staffs the project with adequate numbers of qualified personnel, contractor employs the appropriate design tools, including computer hardware and software, contractor adheres to all appropriate specifications and standards, contractor provides all contract documents, including those referred to in the job specification

Delivering engineering solutions and recommendations to clients within a project environment

Make frequent site visit, identify the construction process and provide technical input whenever it is anticipated.

Candidate Profile:

Education

Higher Technical Education (University Degree in Engineering) in the field of activity or equivalent.

Mandatory Experience:

A minimum of 10 years‚Äô experience in the discipline concerned

Work experience (at least 1 project) in a similar position from Customer side or PMC consultant in EPCC projects in an oil and gas industry (GPP, GCC, refinery, LNG, GTL, full scale field development, international pipeline systems or other project of similar scope and complexity)

Possession of a qualification certificate or certification in accordance with API 580 Risk-Based Inspection and API 571 Corrosion and Materials.

Required Competencies:

Capable of coordinating large projects, leading a professional team.

Acts in a manner of integrity that demonstrates support for the company values and the employees, while maintaining constant focus on meeting Client requirements and expectations.

Advanced knowledge of project management processes. Expert knowledge of Engineering, design, and vendor management.

Competency in conflict and crisis management.

Excellent time and project management skills.

Proven communications and interpersonal skills

Language Proficiency:

English: Advanced communication skills in reading writing, and speaking is mandatory

Russian: Advanced communication skills in reading writing, and speaking is mandatory

name: Dynamics 365 \ Power Platform Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced developer to join our Dynamics 365 projects. The projects involves support, development, customizing of solutions based on Dynamics 365 CE and Power Platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Development and customization of Power Apps and Dynamics 365 CRM solutions.

  • Supporting customers with existing implementations.

  • Integrating Dynamics 365 with external systems.

  • Assisting with scoping and estimating new features and requests.

Requirements:

  • Deep expertise in Dynamics 365 Sales and Power Platform (customization, integrations, knowledge of best practices)

  • Strong development skills in C# and JavaScript for D365

  • Strong Power Automate skills

  • Ability to work in Agile/Scrum environments

  • English level: Intermediate+ (client communication)

Nice to have:

  • Microsoft certifications (Dynamics 365, Power Platform)

We can offer:

  • Projects for such clients as PayPal, Wargaming, Xerox, Philips, adidas and Toyota
  • Competitive compensation that depends on your qualification and skills
  • Career development system with clear skill qualifications
  • Options to work remotely
  • Compensation for medical expenses
  • English courses online
  • Corporate parties and events for employees and their children
  • Internal conferences, workshops and meetups for learning and experience sharing
  • Gym membership compensation, corporate sport competitions (cybersport included)
  • 5 days of paid sick leave per year with no obligation to submit a sick-leave certificate
key_skills: C#, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Platform, JavaScript

name: React Front-end Developer
description:

Required skills:

  • Commercial experience of at least 2 year in using React
  • Experience with application state management tools (Redux and/or MobX)
  • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, TypeScript and JavaScript
  • Experience in working with style preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus)
  • Knowledge of SOLID, DRY, KISS principles
  • Good command of English. Oral communication in English on technical topics

  • Experience in writing automated tests (Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library)
  • Understanding the principles of Backend development regardless of the platform
  • Knowledge of the basics of application containerization, understanding and experience of using Docker

We can offer:

  • Projects for such clients as PayPal, Wargaming, Xerox, Philips, adidas and Toyota

  • Options to work remotely

  • English courses online

name: Software Functional Testing Intern
description:
EPAM Campus offers an intensive Software Functional Testing internship program that will equip you with the deep knowledge and hands-on experience needed to kickstart your career in tech. EPAM professionals will help you learn to conduct requirements analysis for real use cases, develop your skills in creating test artifacts for a specific project, as well as explore the basics of prompt engineering and AI tools for QA specialists.

This program will last ~2-4 months and require ~20-40 hours of weekly engagement. The more time you devote to learning, the faster you will complete it.

Upon its successful completion, we will consider you for open positions based on your demonstrated skills and available opportunities at EPAM.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with the software development & testing life cycle and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing theory‚ÄØ(Test Artifacts; Test Methods, Types and Levels; Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Experience with requirement analysis, test design and defect reporting
  • Excellent communication skills

Nice to have:

Familiarity with API testing and SQL queries

We offer

  • Market-oriented content tested in hundreds of runs
  • Deep dive into your specialization and related emerging technologies
  • Hands-on learning through practical tasks and real project simulations
  • Regular guidance from technology mentors and your Resource Manager
  • AI tools to deliver a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Access to EPAM internal education resources for professional growth
  • Chance to join our team upon successful graduation

name: Automated Testing in .NET Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in .NET training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in –°# and the .NET platform, as well as master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~ 2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of C# programming (Integers, Static Methods, Boolean and Logical Operators, Conditional Statements, Real Numbers, Exceptions, Iteration Statements)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

name: Automated Testing in JavaScript Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in JavaScript training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in JavaScript and master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of JavaScript programming (Variables, Data Types, Conditions and Loops, Functions, Strings, Arrays)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan
  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Software Functional Testing Trainee
description:
EPAM Campus offers a free Software Functional Testing training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will explore various testing types, methods and approaches, master test planning, requirements analysis and creating effective checklists, as well as learn how to report test results.

You can progress through this self-paced program at your convenience, as all learning materials will be accessible anytime. On average, you will need ~ 10 weeks and ~ 20 hours of weekly engagement.

Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with software development & testing life cycles and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing basics (Test Artifacts, Test Methods, Types and Levels, Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)

name: Middle/Senior QA automation engineer
description:
Investbanq is an AI-powered wealth operating system for family offices, asset managers and banks. We are empowering traditional financial institutions to rapidly transform into AI-driven WealthTech players, enabling them to effectively capitalize on the growing wealth transfer to affluent millennials and other digital natives across emerging Asia and MENA. We are scaling quickly across Asia and MENA and are assembling a high‚Äëcalibre engineering team to power our next phase of growth.


Why this role matters

Our users expect real-time performance, accurate data, and airtight security. As a Middle+ QA automation engineer, you‚Äôll own the testing layer that ensures every release meets that standard. You‚Äôll work hand-in-hand with product and engineering to catch bugs before they happen.


Responsibilities

Automate core testing workflows

  • build and maintain scalable test automation suites for API and UI (Playwright or equivalent)
  • write end-to-end, integration, and regression tests for critical backend and frontend flows
  • develop reusable test components and integrate test execution into GitLab CI/CD

Enhance platform stability

  • ensure test coverage across REST/GraphQL APIs, data workflows, and edge cases
  • validate backend/frontend components like messaging (SQS, Redis), scheduled jobs, and data processing
  • implement load and performance tests using k6 or similar tools

Build quality into the pipeline

  • enforce test coverage thresholds and shift-left practices across development stages
  • improve visibility through dashboards and test reports tied into CI pipelines
  • manage test data and environments using Docker and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform)

Collaborate & mentor

  • work closely with backend, frontend, and product teams to define testable requirements
  • participate in code reviews, incident reviews, and QA strategy planning

Requirements

Must-have

  • 3‚ÄØ+‚ÄØyears of experience in QA automation, with a strong focus on backend/API testing
  • solid JavaScript/TypeScript skills and experience with automation tools (e.g., Playwright, Jest, REST-assured)
  • hands-on experience testing REST and GraphQL APIs
  • familiarity with CI/CD (preferably GitLab CI), Docker, and infrastructure management
  • solid understanding of QA processes, test design patterns, and debugging techniques

Nice-to-have

  • experience testing event-driven or real-time systems (e.g., SQS, Redis pub/sub)
  • exposure to PostgreSQL and time-series data (TimescaleDB)
  • load and performance testing with k6, JMeter, or Artillery
  • experience in high-compliance environments (fintech, banking, SOC 2, ISO 27001)
  • contributions to QA communities, OSS, or tech blogs

Working conditions

  • hybrid work environment: 3 days in the office, 2 days remote
  • modern office location in Almaty
  • official employment in compliance with AIFC Employment Regulations
  • opportunities for professional growth and career progression
  • multilingual working environment
  • exposure to cutting-edge AI-driven WealthTech solutions
  • a collaborative and inclusive corporate culture that values innovation and initiative
  • periodic remote (e.g., during winter) from year 2
  • ESOP participation from year 2

name: Junior Frontend Developer (Angular)
description:
Andersen is hiring a Junior Frontend Developer (Angular) for a global tech enterprise. The project involves developing a widget application to streamline and improve the digital claiming process.

Our customer is a global enterprise that develops digital solutions enabling seamless interaction between people, services, and technology. Operating across multiple domains, the company focuses on innovation, reliability, and user-centric design. Its mission is to drive large-scale digital transformation by building sustainable, secure, and agile IT ecosystems that support partners and clients around the world.

The project is focused on delivering a widget application ‚Äì a modular interface component that allows users to access specific services and perform key functions. The current scope includes developing a widget solution aimed at improving and streamlining the claiming process.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing and maintaining web applications using Angular and JavaScript.
  • Implementing UI components and features based on design specifications.
  • Working with Micro Frontends, Widgets to ensure modular and scalable architecture.
  • Writing and maintaining automated tests using Playwright for UI testing.
  • Optimizing web applications for performance and responsiveness.
  • Collaborating with backend developers, designers, and other team members to deliver high-quality solutions.
  • Debugging and resolving front-end issues and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
  • Participating in code reviews and following the best development practices.

Must-haves:

  • Experience with Angular for 6+ months.
  • Solid understanding of JavaScript and modern front-end development principles.
  • Familiarity with Micro Frontends architecture and integration approaches.
  • Basic knowledge of Playwright or similar UI testing frameworks.
  • Understanding of RESTful APIs and working with backend services.
  • Ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and eagerness to learn new technologies.
  • Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
  • Level of English ‚Äì from Upper-Intermediate and above.

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you:

  • Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.
  • The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain.
  • Job conditions ‚Äì you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant.
  • Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee.
  • The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 USD per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities.
  • Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated.
  • Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies).
  • Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc).
  • Referral program.
  • English courses.
  • Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities.

Join us!
key_skills: Angular, Micro Frontends architecture, Playwright, RESTful APIs, JavaScript

name: Software Functional Testing Intern
description:
EPAM Campus offers an intensive Software Functional Testing internship program that will equip you with the deep knowledge and hands-on experience needed to kickstart your career in tech. EPAM professionals will help you learn to conduct requirements analysis for real use cases, develop your skills in creating test artifacts for a specific project, as well as explore the basics of prompt engineering and AI tools for QA specialists.

This program will last ~2-4 months and require ~20-40 hours of weekly engagement. The more time you devote to learning, the faster you will complete it.

Upon its successful completion, we will consider you for open positions based on your demonstrated skills and available opportunities at EPAM.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with the software development & testing life cycle and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing theory‚ÄØ(Test Artifacts; Test Methods, Types and Levels; Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Experience with requirement analysis, test design and defect reporting
  • Excellent communication skills

Nice to have:

Familiarity with API testing and SQL queries

We offer

  • Market-oriented content tested in hundreds of runs
  • Deep dive into your specialization and related emerging technologies
  • Hands-on learning through practical tasks and real project simulations
  • Regular guidance from technology mentors and your Resource Manager
  • AI tools to deliver a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Access to EPAM internal education resources for professional growth
  • Chance to join our team upon successful graduation

name: Automated Testing in Java Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in Java training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in Java and master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of Java programming (Data Types, Conditions and Loops, Arrays, Classes)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials

  • Technology mentors from around the globe

  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs

name: Software Functional Testing Trainee
description:
EPAM Campus offers a free Software Functional Testing training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will explore various testing types, methods and approaches, master test planning, requirements analysis and creating effective checklists, as well as learn how to report test results.

You can progress through this self-paced program at your convenience, as all learning materials will be accessible anytime. On average, you will need ~ 10 weeks and ~ 20 hours of weekly engagement.

Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with software development & testing life cycles and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing basics (Test Artifacts, Test Methods, Types and Levels, Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Strong communication skills

Nice to have:

  • Understanding of programming basics, networks, API and databases

We offer

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Software Functional Testing Intern
description:
EPAM Campus offers an intensive Software Functional Testing internship program that will equip you with the deep knowledge and hands-on experience needed to kickstart your career in tech. EPAM professionals will help you learn to conduct requirements analysis for real use cases, develop your skills in creating test artifacts for a specific project, as well as explore the basics of prompt engineering and AI tools for QA specialists.

This program will last ~2-4 months and require ~20-40 hours of weekly engagement. The more time you devote to learning, the faster you will complete it.

Upon its successful completion, we will consider you for open positions based on your demonstrated skills and available opportunities at EPAM.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with the software development & testing life cycle and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing theory‚ÄØ(Test Artifacts; Test Methods, Types and Levels; Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Experience with requirement analysis, test design and defect reporting
  • Excellent communication skills

Nice to have:

Familiarity with API testing and SQL queries

We offer

  • Market-oriented content tested in hundreds of runs
  • Deep dive into your specialization and related emerging technologies
  • Hands-on learning through practical tasks and real project simulations
  • Regular guidance from technology mentors and your Resource Manager
  • AI tools to deliver a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Access to EPAM internal education resources for professional growth
  • Chance to join our team upon successful graduation

description:
–û–±—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏:

  • Release Management: –ü–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–µ–ø–ª–æ–π–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ (Deployment Plans), —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–ª–∏–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–π –∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ—Å–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π.
  • –ú–æ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥ –∏ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞: –û—Ç—Å–ª–µ–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å—è —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–æ–≤ (Platform Health), –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –ª–æ–≥–æ–≤ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –≤ Service Center, –¥–∏–∞–≥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–µ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ü–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤.
  • –ë–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å: –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–æ–º –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π (IT Users & End Users), –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–∞ —Ä–æ–ª–µ–π –∏ –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏.

4. –ê–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—è:

  • –í–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥–∞ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –≤ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏.
  • –í–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –¥–æ–∫—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ API.
–¢—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è:

1. –ü—Ä–æ–¥–≤–∏–Ω—É—Ç–∞—è —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ (Logic & Processes):

  • BPT & Workflow Automation: –û–ø—ã—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤ —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º BPT (Business Process Technology) –∏ Light BPT. –£–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã, human interactions –∏ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω—É—é –º–∞—Ä—à—Ä—É—Ç–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—é –∑–∞–¥–∞—á.
  • Asynchronous Processing: –ì–ª—É–±–æ–∫–æ–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã Timers (—Ç–∞–π–º–µ—Ä–æ–≤) –¥–ª—è —Ñ–æ–Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á. –£–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–æ–≤—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫—É —Å –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç–æ–π –æ—Ç Timeout, –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–æ–π –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –æ–±—ä–µ–º–æ–≤ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö (Batch Processing) –∏ –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–æ–≤ –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–∫ (Retry Logic).
  • Exception Handling: –ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≥–ª–æ–±–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ (Global Exception Handler) –∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∑–∞–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö. –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç Database Transactions –∏ –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º —Ä—É—á–Ω–æ–π Commit/Rollback.

2. Front-End –∏–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∏—è –∏ UI/UX:

  • Reactive Web App Lifecycle: –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ü–∏–∫–ª–∞ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–æ–≤ –∏ –±–ª–æ–∫–æ–≤ (OnInitialize, OnReady, OnRender, OnDestroy). –£–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏.
  • Custom Code Integration: –£–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä—è—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—ã —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é JavaScript Nodes. –û–ø—ã—Ç –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è –∫–∞—Å—Ç–æ–º–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–≤, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–∏—Ö JS-–±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫ –∏ –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∞—è –∫–∞—Å—Ç–æ–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ–π —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ CSS/Sass (–Ω–µ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏–≤–∞—è—Å—å —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Ç–µ–º–∞–º–∏ OutSystems UI).
  • Client-Side Logic: –ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ–π –∫–ª–∏–µ–Ω—Ç—Å–∫–æ–π –ª–æ–≥–∏–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è —Å–Ω–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä (Client Variables, Local Storage, Offline capabilities).

name: Automated Testing in .NET Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in .NET training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in –°# and the .NET platform, as well as master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~ 2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of C# programming (Integers, Static Methods, Boolean and Logical Operators, Conditional Statements, Real Numbers, Exceptions, Iteration Statements)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan
  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

  3. –ö–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç—ã —Å –ø—Ä–µ–æ–±–ª–∞–¥–∞—é—â–∏–º –∏–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∏–ª–∞–Ω—Å–µ –∏–ª–∏ –≤ –∞—É—Ç—Å–æ—Ä—Å–∏–Ω–≥-–∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö.

–ú–´ –û–ñ–ò–î–ê–ï–ú:

50% Build ‚Äî design & ship

  1. Build responsive React (TypeScript) frontends (state mgmt, data viz, virtualized tables, forms, charts, file uploads, accessibility).
  2. Implement FastAPI services (async I/O, Pydantic v2, background jobs, caching) with robust testing.
  3. Design Elasticsearch models & queries
  4. Integrate AI features (streaming responses, structured outputs, eval hooks) to accelerate prototyping and user value.

25% Scale & operate

  1. Ship and run services on AWS and/or GCP (ECS/EKS/Lambda or Cloud Run/GKE), containerized with Docker.
  2. Own CI/CD (GitHub Actions), IaC (Terraform), logging/metrics/tracing (OpenTelemetry, CloudWatch/Stackdriver, Grafana/Prometheus), and SLOs.
  3. Optimize p95 latency, throughput, and cost; manage secrets, networking, VPCs, and build resilient retries/backoffs.

15% Collaborate

  1. Work closely with design/PM on specs and UX polish; pair with back-end/ML on data contracts and APIs.
  2. Partner with the Insights team on taxonomy/schema changes and with Data/ML on search & analytics expectations.

10% Align & showcase

  1. Write crisp docs, PRDs/tech notes, and demo your work to execs & customers.
  2. Contribute to on-call for your services and drive post-mortems to closure.

  3. –û–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –æ—Ç 2 –ª–µ—Ç —Å FastAPI: –∞—Å–∏–Ω—Ö—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã, Pydantic —Å—Ö–µ–º—ã, –ø–∞–≥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è, –∞—É—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è (OAuth2 / OIDC), –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ñ–æ–Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è.

name: Ruby on Rails Middle Developer
description:
We are looking for experienced developers that are willing to solve complex technical issues while developing high quality software systems using modern technologies.

What we expect from you:

  • 1+ years of experience in IT;
  • experience in Ruby on Rails development;
  • experience with databases (SQL or NoSQL);
  • English language level should be sufficient for written communication.

It would be a plus to have:

  • experience in Frontend development (HTML 5, JavaScript / TypeScript, Angular / React or other);
  • experience with automated testing;
  • knowledge of containerization principles, hands-on experience with Docker.

We can offer:

  • Projects for such clients as PayPal, Wargaming, Xerox, Philips, adidas and Toyota
  • Competitive compensation that depends on your qualification and skills
  • Career development system with clear skill qualifications
  • Flexible working hours aligned to your schedule
  • Options to work remotely
  • Corporate medical insurance covering services of private and public medical centers
  • English courses online
  • Corporate parties and events for employees and their children
  • Gym membership compensation, corporate sport competitions (cybersport included)
  • 5 days of paid sick leave per year with no obligation to submit a sick-leave certificate
key_skills: JavaScript, Ruby On Rails, HTML, SQL, MS SQL

name: Team Lead for Service Line
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Lead the daily operations of the local delivery team, ensuring services meet expectations.
  • Deliver and oversee solutions in Windows Server, Azure, O365, SQL, AD/AAD, and IT Security.
  • Allocate workload, track progress, and manage risks to keep projects on time and budget.
  • Handle escalations, resolve challenges, and maintain strong customer relationships.
  • Mentor, coach, and develop team members, fostering collaboration and growth.
  • Work closely with global teams to align delivery standards and share best practices.

Requirements:

  • Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and guide others.
  • Hands-on technical experience in Microsoft platforms and IT services delivery.
  • Proven ability to manage customers, prioritize effectively, and solve complex issues.
  • Experience with project or service management in multi-client environments.
  • Fluency in English (Russian or Kazakh is a plus).
  • Relevant Microsoft or service delivery certifications are welcome.

Terms:

  • Global company culture: We defined our 7 core values through our company culture
  • A‚ÄØmentor‚ÄØwho supports your successful start and is at your side with advice and action.
  • President‚Äôs Club: Recognition awarded by leadership and your peers.
  • Flexible work: Do great work from anywhere but also visit local office to deliver excellence in team relationship.
  • Lifelong education: A variety of‚ÄØtraining and development opportunities.
  • Employee stock option programs (SIX: SWON): Be an owner. All employees can be shareholders.
  • Hire to Grow: We optimize our internal structures and feedback culture constantly to be your Employer of Choice, today and in future.

name: Mid-level Python Developer
description:
–í–∞–∂–Ω–æ

–†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ—Ç —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–æ—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ –¢—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤–æ–º—É –∫–æ–¥–µ–∫—Å—É –†–ö. –§–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç—ã –ì–ü–• –∏–ª–∏ –ò–ü –Ω–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è.

–¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏–º –≤–∞—Å —É–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞—Ä–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤ —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –ø–∏—Å—å–º–µ.

‚†Ä

About Us

We are a growing international team with headquarters in Helsinki and a tech hub in Tallinn.

Our parent company, Trumo Finance, is a forward-thinking fintech company delivering secure, efficient, and innovative payment solutions for businesses and consumers ‚Äî with a strong presence in the iGaming industry.

Learn more on https://trumo.com

To support our continued growth, we‚Äôve recently opened a new office in Astana and are excited to build a talented local team to join our mission.

‚†Ä

Job Description

Key Responsibilities:

- Platform Development. Collaborate with product managers and engineers to build and maintain features for the Trumo payment platform. Implement services and backend components in Python (FastAPI/Flask), focusing on reliability and clarity.

- Architecture & APIs. Contribute to the design of secure, scalable services within a microservices environment. Design, implement, and maintain well-documented RESTful APIs that are easy to integrate and evolve.

- Troubleshooting & Optimization. Investigate bugs and performance issues; propose pragmatic fixes and optimizations. Proactively flag risks or areas for improvement in performance, security, and user experience.

- Teamwork & Growth. Share knowledge via PR reviews and documentation. Participate in operational tasks like environment configs and basic observability (logs/metrics/traces).

‚†Ä

Required Skills & Qualifications:

- Experience: 2‚Äì4 years of professional Python experience in production.
Frameworks: Proficiency with FastAPI or Flask (Django experience also valued).

- API Design: Proven experience designing and maintaining RESTful APIs (versioning, pagination, auth, docs).

- Databases: Solid SQL skills (e.g., PostgreSQL) and working knowledge of a NoSQL store (Redis or MongoDB). Comfortable modelling schemas and writing performant queries.

- Microservices & Distributed Systems: Practical experience building/consuming services and working with messaging/async patterns; understands service boundaries and resiliency basics.

- Docker: Hands-on experience containerising applications and using Docker Compose locally.

- Testing & CI: Experience with pytest/unittest, code reviews, and CI tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, etc.).

- Problem-Solving & Communication: Strong debugging skills, clear written/verbal communication, and collaborative mindset.

- Security Awareness: Familiar with secure API practices (authN/Z, secrets management, input validation) and basic data protection concepts.

- Solid English

‚†Ä

Nice to Have:

- Cloud: Exposure to AWS (EC2, S3, IAM, ECS/EKS or similar) and infrastructure automation basics.

- Fintech/Payments: Experience in financial services, payment processing, or PCI-aware environments.

- Frontend Touchpoints: Familiarity with React or modern frontend workflows for API integration.

- Observability: Experience with tools like Prometheus/Grafana, OpenTelemetry, or ELK.

- Advanced CI/CD: Experience optimizing build pipelines and deployment strategies.

‚†Ä

Tech Stack:

- Languages & Frameworks: Python, FastAPI, Flask

- Databases: PostgreSQL; Redis and/or MongoDB

- Tools: Docker, Docker Compose, NGINX

- Cloud: AWS

- OS: Linux

name: Automated Testing in Java Trainee
description:
Details

EPAM Campus offers a free Automated Testing in Java training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will learn core software development and testing tools, advance your proficiency in Java and master modern frameworks for test automation.

This program will last ~2.5 months and require ~20 hours of weekly engagement. Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level of B1 (Intermediate) and higher
  • Basic knowledge of Java programming (Data Types, Conditions and Loops, Arrays, Classes)
  • Familiarity with testing theory (Static & Dynamic Testing, Requirement Analysis, Software Testing Methods & Levels, Testing Pyramid, Functional & Non-Functional Testing Types, Test Planning, Checklists, Test Cases & Suites, Defects, Test Result Reports)
  • Understanding of test automation goals
  • Basic knowledge of version control with Git
  • Ability to work with self-study materials and meet deadlines

We offer

  • Remote learning from any location in Kazakhstan

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials

  • Technology mentors from around the globe

  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs

  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience

  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Technical Director
description:
The Technical Director provides strategic leadership for all technical functions at the soda ash plant, including process engineering, product quality, R&D, and technology development. This role is responsible for driving continuous improvement, optimizing process efficiency, implementing technological upgrades, and ensuring safe, reliable, and cost-effective operations.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead and manage the technical, process engineering, and quality teams.
Oversee process optimization, debottlenecking, and troubleshooting of plant operations.
Drive innovation and implement new technologies to improve plant performance.
Develop and implement strategic plans for technical development and capital improvement projects.
Collaborate with operations, maintenance, EHS, and energy teams to enhance plant reliability and efficiency.
Ensure product quality meets or exceeds internal specifications and customer expectations.
Manage technical support for plant expansion, modernization, and new product development.
Lead root cause analysis (RCA) and implement corrective actions for process deviations.
Maintain technical documentation, SOPs, and ensure compliance with industry and regulatory standards.
Serve as a key technical advisor to senior leadership and external stakeholders.
Qualifications & Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
Master‚Äôs degree or MBA is a plus.
15+ years in chemical process industries, with a strong focus on soda ash, fertilizer, cement, or similar sectors.
Minimum 5 years in a technical leadership or senior engineering management role.
Proven experience in managing large-scale continuous process operations.
Expertise in soda ash manufacturing processes (Solvay, Hou, or other relevant processes).
Strong understanding of process control systems (DCS/PLC), mass and energy balance, and process safety.
Experience in CAPEX project planning and execution.

name: Android Developer (Kotlin) in Almaty
description:
Andersen is looking for an Android Developer (Kotlin) in Almaty for a project with a major Kazakhstan bank. The role involves developing a mobile banking app for business clients with features like payments and account management.

The customer is one of Kazakhstan‚Äôs leading commercial banks. Serving over 3 million retail and corporate clients, it operates a nationwide network of branches and service outlets. The bank offers a comprehensive portfolio of financial services, including loans, cards, deposits, investment solutions, and digital banking tools.

The project is focused on developing modules for a new mobile banking application for business clients. It aims to deliver a modern, user-friendly platform that supports key services such as account management, payments, and transaction tracking. This initiative is part of a broader strategy to enhance digital banking experiences for corporate users.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing and enhancing new and existing products.
  • Optimizing application performance.
  • Interacting with external APIs.
  • Testing and documenting code.
  • Working on tasks as a team.
  • Learning new technologies and improving personal knowledge.
  • Participating in all team activities.
  • Adhering to documented processes.

Must-haves:

  • Experience as an Android Developer for 2+ years.
  • Advanced knowledge of Kotlin: ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
  • Experience with Android: deep understanding of the platform, including architecture, lifecycle, and core components.
  • Asynchronous programming: strong proficiency with coroutines and understanding of async principles.
  • Experience working with MVI and MVVM architectures.
  • Knowledge and practical application of key design patterns.
  • Level of English ‚Äì from Intermediate and above.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience working in fintech companies.
  • Experience with Jetpack Compose.

Reasons why this job would be interesting to you:

  • Experience in teamwork with leaders in FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, Telecom, and others. Andersen cooperates with such businesses as Samsung, Siemens, Johnson & Johnson, BNP Paribas, Ryanair, Mercedes, TUI, Verivox, Allianz, T-Systems, etc.;
  • The opportunity to change the project and/or develop expertise in an interesting business domain;
  • Job conditions ‚Äì you can work both fully remotely and from the office or can choose a hybrid variant;
  • Guarantee of professional, financial, and career growth! The company has introduced systems of mentoring and adaptation for each new employee;
  • The opportunity to earn up to an additional 1,000 EUR per month, depending on the level of expertise, which will be included in the annual bonus, by participating in the company's activities;
  • Access to the corporate training portal, where the entire knowledge base of the company is collected and which is constantly updated;
  • Bright corporate life (parties / pizza days / PlayStation / fruits / coffee / snacks / movies);
  • Certification compensation (AWS, PMP, etc);
  • Referral program;
  • English courses;
  • Private health insurance and compensation for sports activities.

Join us!

name: Software Functional Testing Trainee
description:
EPAM Campus offers a free Software Functional Testing training program to help you gain market-oriented hard and soft skills alongside IT professionals. In this intensive course, you will explore various testing types, methods and approaches, master test planning, requirements analysis and creating effective checklists, as well as learn how to report test results.

You can progress through this self-paced program at your convenience, as all learning materials will be accessible anytime. On average, you will need ~ 10 weeks and ~ 20 hours of weekly engagement.

Completing it won't guarantee a job, but it will lay a solid foundation to enter the profession confidently, either at our company or in the broader IT market.

Requirements

  • English level from B1 (Intermediate)‚ÄØand higher
  • Familiarity with software development & testing life cycles and Agile frameworks
  • Solid knowledge of functional testing basics (Test Artifacts, Test Methods, Types and Levels, Main Testing Terms; Test Planning and Analysis; Test Documentation; Test Design Techniques; Defect and Results Reporting)
  • Strong communication skills

Nice to have:

  • Understanding of programming basics, networks, API and databases

We offer

  • Free-of-charge training program and educational materials
  • Technology mentors from around the globe
  • Market-oriented content tested in numerous runs
  • AI tools for delivering a cutting-edge learning experience
  • Opportunity to join more advanced training stages

name: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Armeta is developing advanced AI-driven systems that transform how large-scale engineering and construction projects are evaluated and approved. Our technology automates complex, compliance-heavy processes, ensuring accuracy and trustworthiness.

We are building a high-performance, on-premise computing platform to power our complex multi-agent, data, and backend systems, and we are looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to build and manage this critical infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the development of sophisticated, high-performance, and responsive user interfaces using React and TypeScript.

  • Build complex, data-heavy applications, including dashboards, interactive visualizations, and other interfaces for our core AI products.

  • Collaborate closely with UI/UX designers to translate complex requirements and Figma mockups into pixel-perfect, intuitive, and accessible web applications.

  • Architect and maintain scalable frontend state management solutions for large applications.

  • Integrate frontend components with backend services, consuming REST APIs from our FastAPI-based microservice architecture.

  • Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code, establishing and enforcing best practices for the frontend codebase.

  • Optimize application performance for maximum speed, scalability, and responsiveness.

  • Mentor junior and mid-level developers, conduct thorough code reviews, and help foster a culture of engineering excellence.

  • Work with DevOps to containerize frontend applications using Docker and streamline CI/CD pipelines.

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of professional experience in frontend development, with a strong portfolio of complex web applications.

  • Expert-level proficiency in React and its core principles, including hooks and context.

  • Strong command of TypeScript and its use in large-scale applications.

  • Deep understanding of modern frontend build tools (e.g., Vite, Webpack) and the JavaScript ecosystem.

  • Proven experience with advanced state management libraries (e.g., Redux Toolkit, Zustand, MobX).

  • Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Vitest) and a commitment to code quality.

  • Strong understanding of how to consume RESTful APIs and handle asynchronous operations.

  • Solid understanding of microservice-based architectures and the frontend's role within such a system.

  • Practical experience with Docker for containerizing frontend applications.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work full-time in a fast-paced startup environment.

  • Experience with component libraries (e.g., Ant Design).

  • Familiarity with CI/CD practices and tools.

Preferred Qualifications :

  • Experience with data visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Recharts, ECharts).

  • Experience with real-time data streaming (e.g., WebSockets).

  • Knowledge of backend development (especially Python/FastAPI) is a significant plus.

name: Senior Microsoft Exchange Administrator
description:
Since 1993, Netcracker Technology has been developing and implementing unique IT solutions for more than 250 customers worldwide, mostly telecom providers. We create dozens of innovative products and lead the global market of BSS/OSS solutions ready to be used in the cloud environment. Our comprehensive portfolio of software solutions and professional services enables large-scale digital transformations, unlocking the cloud's opportunities, virtualization, and the changing mobile ecosystem.

We are looking for a Senior Microsoft Exchange Administrator to be responsible for the development and support of our email infrastructure solutions.

Why join our team:

  • Work on design, development, and customization of mission-critical email solutions for world-leading companies.
  • Get unlimited opportunities for professional and career development in a global company.

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Administer and support on-premise MS Exchange environments.
  • Manage and maintain hybrid configurations.
  • Implement and support email security solutions, including anti-spam, anti-virus, and encryption.
  • Perform regular system maintenance, updates, and patches.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex email-related issues and incidents.
  • Collaborate with IT teams to integrate Exchange services with other systems and applications.
  • Provide end-user support and troubleshooting
  • Work on critical and high severity incidents and problems: identify root causes and provide appropriate solutions; provide timely status updates and reports.

What we are looking for:

  • Must have at least 10+ years‚Äô experience in IT and\or Information Security.
  • Proven experience in managing and supporting MS Exchange environments.
  • Strong knowledge of email security protocols and solutions.
  • Understanding of PowerShell scripting for automation and management tasks.
  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to assume a leadership role, owning the job, team player, constant focusing on results.
  • Knowledgeable in Network/TCP fundamental

Optional (will be a plus):

  • Knowledgeable in Office 365 and related services.
  • Experience with other email platforms and migration tools.
  • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Messaging Administrator Associate, Microsoft 365 Certified: Administrator Expert or similar.
